v.v: Pay attention to what Yahweh will say:
The mountains must listen carefully to what Yahweh says about his people, so they can be witnesses.
He says this: “My people, what have I done to cause trouble for you ?
I did great things for your ancestors;
My people, think about when Balak, the king of Moab, requested Beor’s son Balaam to curse your ancestors,
The Israelite people ask, “What shall we bring to Yahweh who lives in heaven
Would Yahweh be pleased if we offered to him a thousand rams
No, because he has shown each of us what is good to do;
God says this: “I am Yahweh, so if you are wise, you should honor me.
You wicked people have filled your homes with valuable things
You do not think that I should say nothing about people who use scales that do not weigh correctly,
The rich people among you always act violently to get money from poor people.
Therefore, I have already begun to get rid of you,
Soon you will eat food, but you will not have enough to satisfy you;
You will plant crops,
Those things will happen to you because you obey only the wicked laws of King Omri,
I am very miserable!
Everyone who honored God has disappeared from this land;
They do what is evil with all their might.
Even the best people are as worthless as briers;
So do not trust anyone!
Boys will despise their fathers,
As for me, I wait for Yahweh to help me.
You who are our enemies,
We must be patient while Yahweh punishes us
Our enemies will also see it, and they will be disgraced
You people of Israel, at that time your cities will be rebuilt,
Your people will come back to you from many countries,
But the other countries on the earth will become desolate
Yahweh, protect your people as a shepherd protects his sheep with his staff.

v: Micah says to Yahweh, “Stand up in court and accuse the Israelites.
Allow the hills and mountains to hear what you will say.
Indeed, Yahweh has many things to accuse his people Israel about.
What have I done to cause you to experience difficulties?
Answer me!
I brought them out of Egypt;
I rescued them from that land where they were slaves.
I sent Moses to lead them,
and his older brother Aaron and his older sister Miriam.
and think about what Balaam replied.
Think about how your ancestors crossed the Jordan River miraculously while they were traveling from Acacia to Gilgal.
Think about those things in order that you may know that I, Yahweh, do what is right.”

that will be offerings that will be killed and completely burned on the altar?
and ten thousand streams of olive oil?
Should we offer our firstborn children to be sacrifices
to pay for the sins that we have committed?”
he has shown us what he requires each of us to do:
he wants us to do what is just and to love to act mercifully toward others,
and he wants us to live humbly while we fellowship with him, our God.
I am calling out to you people of Jerusalem to tell you this:
The armies that will destroy your city are coming,
so pay careful attention to me, the one who is causing them to punish you with my rod.
